note: This file can be renamed to client-preferences.json for new projects
source: Extracted from 3 meetings (Jan 5, 7, 9, 2026) and Product 58498 analysis

preferred.description: Preferred margin - excellent viability for established items

minimum_acceptable.evidence: Meetings 1 & 2 explicit statements, validated in 15-product analysis

special_review.description: Requires additional validation - not auto-reject but needs justification
review_criteria: Path to 15%+ margin (price increase potential, cost reduction)
Volume economics (full container significantly improves margin)
special_review.evidence: Updated Jan 2026 - Todd accepts review tier for borderline cases

rejection_threshold.description: Below 10% = automatic reject, no viable path to profitability
rejection_threshold.evidence: Meeting 2 explicit statement, validated in 15-product analysis

exception_case.condition: New launch with strong market validation

price_point_preferences.rationale: Higher price points reduce impact of shipping, picking, packing, storage, and Amazon fees
price_point_preferences.flexibility: Exceptions based on competitive analysis data

fulfillment_preferences.rationale: Critical for buy box win rate, Prime eligibility, algorithm favor

willing_to_accept: Negative margins temporarily for validated aggressive launches
Seasonal products if margins 50%+ and can maintain off-season inventory
Test batches (24-48 units) on high-ticket items
unwilling_to_accept: Rushing decisions to meet factory deadlines without validation
Products with <15% margin even after optimization
High insurance risk products (past experience with inflatables)
Brand approval blockers without resolution path

inflatable_castle_venture.lesson: High-cube, high-ticket, highly seasonal, high-risk products problematic

ranked_importance.rationale: Investment into listing optimization wasted if stockout

ranked_importance.description: Deeper inventory safer, maintains algorithm recognition

ranked_importance.rationale: Best Way shutting down unauthorized sellers

ranked_importance.description: B2B Amazon Business opportunity, obligation to small/medium customers

preferred_evidence: Retail sales data (e.g., $5M Coleman annual sales)
Competitor revenue as indicator of actual buying activity
validation_requirements.minimum_before_proceeding: Comprehensive DataDive analysis + margin validation at full container volume

seasonal_items.approach: Bring less inventory, test market, minimize investment until validated
seasonal_items.off_season_strategy: Keep listings active, limited advertising 2-4 weeks before peak to 'spark' algorithm
seasonal_items.critical_timing: Never allow stockouts - kills keyword ranking

test_batch_size.use_case: High-ticket items, maintaining listing presence, minimizing risk
test_batch_size.advantage: Ability to order small quantities keeps items active

freight_allocation.preferred_method: Flat rate for mixed small containers
freight_allocation.formula: Total container cost รท number of units = $ per unit
freight_allocation.advantage: Dramatically improves margins on bulky items
freight_allocation.decision_rule: Calculate both, use flat rate if better for product mix

volume_requirements.cost_difference: ~50% reduction from small batch to full container
volume_requirements.critical_learning: Product viability depends entirely on volume

launch_timing.seasonal_products: April launch for May-August peak season
launch_timing.rationale: Hit seasonal window when category picks up

decision_timeline.prefers: Thorough validation over arbitrary factory deadlines
decision_timeline.quote: Better to launch later with validated products than rush to meet arbitrary deadlines with unvalidated selection
decision_timeline.goal: Sustainable profitability, not just meeting ship dates

coleman.relationship: Licensed brand, obligation to supply small/medium retail customers

advantages: Access to P360 intranet with specs, copy, digital assets
best_way.exclusivity_status: Shutting down unauthorized sellers in US and Canada

competitive_assessment.concerning_competition: Very Strong competitors dominating (96%+ page 1 coverage)
opportunity_indicators: Weak competitor listings (poor SEO, weak images)
Big brands with poor Amazon execution (Little Tikes example)
FBM listings that can be converted to FBA

communication_preferences.decision_style: Collaborative, values data and expert recommendations
information_needs: Clear margin calculations at full container volume
communication_preferences.meeting_style: Deep dives into specific products, detailed discussions

learning_notes.confidence_in_preferences: High (95%) based on 3 detailed meetings and explicit statements
gaps_to_fill: Tolerance for multiple products with negative initial margins
Preference on new listing vs existing listing with reviews
Acceptable TACoS percentage for mature products
learning_notes.next_calibration: After Todd's decision on Product 58498 and next 2-3 products
